Posts.EditableText:
Was going to add sound effects (Wav files) to a game I'd developing. Unfortunately I can't get them to work. I had notes on how to do this but I can't find them either.

So here's what I've got, with the wave file in the same folder as this squiffy file.

```
[[start]]:

sound test

<audio src="button_toilet.wav" autoplay />

```
Is there something I need to initialize to make this work?
Posts.HTML:
Was going to add sound effects (Wav files) to a game I'd developing. Unfortunately I can't get them to work. I had notes on how to do this but I can't find them either.

So here's what I've got, with the wave file in the same folder as this squiffy file.

[[start]]:

sound test

<audio src="button_toilet.wav" autoplay />

Is there something I need to initialize to make this work?

Posts.EditableText: Weirdly, it will not work in the first section called by default (the top). But move it down one and it works just fine. Hmmmm...
Posts.HTML: Weirdly, it will not work in the first section called by default (the top). But move it down one and it works just fine. Hmmmm...

Posts.EditableText: I usually do well with Java script instead. It’s less to type and gives me more control. I used it in my first real text adventure, In Cold Blood. I was able to change the volume and stuff sups the dups easily as well as many other variables with it.
Posts.HTML: I usually do well with Java script instead. It’s less to type and gives me more control. I used it in my first real text adventure, In Cold Blood. I was able to change the volume and stuff sups the dups easily as well as many other variables with it.

Posts.EditableText: Yeah, I've got places I had to change it in Javascript (because it was a full JS section). It wasn't too tough to get working.
Posts.HTML: Yeah, I've got places I had to change it in Javascript (because it was a full JS section). It wasn't too tough to get working.
